title: Veterinary Diagnosis: Puppy Emergency
hint: A highly contagious viral disease affecting puppies

clues.text: Severe bloody diarrhea with a distinctive foul odor
clues.explanation: Parvovirus attacks rapidly dividing cells in the intestinal lining, causing severe hemorrhagic diarrhea with a characteristic metallic smell.

clues.text: Most common in unvaccinated puppies aged 6 weeks to 6 months
clues.explanation: Young puppies are most vulnerable before completing their vaccination series, as maternal antibodies wane and immunity hasn't fully developed.

clues.text: Extreme lethargy and refusal to eat or drink
clues.explanation: The virus causes severe systemic illness with profound weakness, anorexia, and rapid dehydration.

clues.text: Persistent vomiting leading to severe dehydration
clues.explanation: Viral damage to the GI tract causes uncontrollable vomiting, which combined with diarrhea leads to life-threatening fluid loss.

clues.text: Low white blood cell count on bloodwork
clues.explanation: Parvovirus attacks bone marrow cells, causing leukopenia (low WBC count), which increases risk of secondary bacterial infections.

clues.text: Positive fecal ELISA test for viral antigen
clues.explanation: The fecal SNAP test detects parvovirus antigen in stool samples, providing rapid confirmation of infection in clinical settings.
